thread.title: Treasury Secretary Says U.S., China Have Suspended Tariffs

author: Josh Zumbrun
title: Treasury Secretary Says U.S., China Have Suspended Tariffs
text:
The U.S. suspended its threat to impose tariffs on $150 billion in Chinese imports to the U.S. while negotiations with China continue, but President Donald Trump could impose the tariffs if a deal between the two countries doesn’t progress, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said.
“Both parties have agreed to suspend the tariffs,” Mr. Mnuchin said Monday in an interview on CNBC, echoing remarks he gave over the weekend. He specified that the U.S. was pausing its efforts to apply tariffs to $150 billion in Chinese imports to... RELATED VIDEO What the U.S.-China Trade War Means for Workers on the Ground Trade pressure on farmers has helped fuel the latest talks between U.S. and China aimed at lifting tariffs on soybeans, hogs and more. Here, an American farmer and a steelworker explain how tariffs are affecting their livelihoods.
